reviewText: Starring ultimate tough guy Broderick Crawford, chief of the Highway Patrol.  The 50s classic TV series was based on the real experiences of Highway Patrol officers in the 48 states at that time.  No, there aren't any high speed crashes or special effects - just an account of incidents that took place during a much simpler time.  If you grew up during that era (or wish you did), the series is worth viewing to see all the cool cars, how we dressed, acted, spoke, etc.  How times have changed....
I don't believe that two less exciting episodes could have been chosen. Very disappointing.
